p: Fucoidan, a polysaccharide from the marine alga, Cladosiphon okamuranus prevented dengue virus infection ( Teixeira et al., 2014). The effect is specific on retroviruses by using heparan sulphate as primary viral receptors ( Besednova et al., 2019). Carrageenan, from Gigartina skottsbergii inhibited Influenza virus, HIV, HPV, HSV-1, HSV-2, and dengue virus. Galactan from red algae like Callophyllis variegate and Agardhiella tenera possessed antiviral properties against HIV, HSV-1, -2, Dengue virus, and Hepatitis A virus. Alginate from brown algae inhibited Hepatitis B, Influenza A, and HIV. Fucan from brown algae like Adenocytis utricularis and Undaria pinnatifida expressed antiviral activities against HIV, HSV, Sindbis virus, and Vesicular Stomatitis Indiana virus. The extract of red alga, Schizymenia pacifica exhibited antiviral properties against HIV ( Ahmadi et al., 2015).
